text: Keith Tippett (born Keith Graham Tippetts; 25 August 1947 â€“ 14 June 2020) was a British jazz pianist and composer. He was born in Bristol, Avon. In the late 1960s, Tippett led a sextet featuring Elton Dean on saxophone, Mark Charig on trumpet and Nick Evans on trombone. He also performed with King Crimson and performed in their "Cat Food" song. Tippett died on 14 June 2020, aged 72. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2020 deaths Category:British jazz musicians Category:British pianists Category:Musicians from Bristol Category:20th-century British composers Category:21st-century British composers
title: Keith Tippett
